modules.description: Creates a query object from a string, enabling structured access to query parameters. Works with a custom type `t` that encapsulates query data. Used to parse and retrieve values from URL query strings in web applications.

Provides functions to locate the start and end indices of a substring within a string, returning an option type with a tuple of integers when a match is found. Operates on string data types and uses pattern matching to determine exact positions. Used to extract specific word segments from larger text inputs for analysis or processing.

Provides string similarity calculations using Levenshtein distance and fuzzy matching algorithms. Operates on strings and lists of strings to identify close matches and rank them by similarity score. Used to suggest corrections for typos in user input or match incomplete data entries.

Encapsulates query parsing and string indexing capabilities, offering structured access to URL parameters and precise substring location. Features a custom type for query data and string-based operations that return start and end positions as optional tuples. Parses query strings to extract values and identifies exact word boundaries for text analysis. Enables tasks like filtering URL parameters and isolating specific text segments for further processing.

Checks if a string matches a pattern using a customizable character comparison function, supporting case-sensitive or case-insensitive matching. Operates on strings and employs a user-defined equality function for character comparison. Used to validate input formats where exact matches are not required, such as parsing user-generated text or handling typos.
